alert.note: Alert for Floyd (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 5:09PM CDT until March 31 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR EASTERN FLOYD AND CHICKASAW COUNTIES... At 509 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Elma to near Nashua to 9 miles north of Waverly, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Ionia around 520 PM CDT. New Hampton around 535 PM CDT. Fredericksburg around 540 PM CDT. Lawler and Jerico around 550 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Bradford, Chickasaw, New Hampton Airport, County Roads B 28 And V 18, Republic, Highway 18 And County V 18 and County Roads V 56 And B 33. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for north central and northeastern Iowa. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
